title: Frydenberg met Keating over super review
text:
Having flagged it first just a week after the Morrison government’s shock re-election in May, Treasurer Josh Frydenberg finally unwrapped his review of retirement income on Friday.

Besides raising the age of eligibility for the age pension, including the family home in its asset test and changing taxes on superannuation, everything is on the table!

Paul Keating met Josh Frydenberg five weeks ago at UBS. Jim Rice

Frydenberg’s review was recommended by the Productivity Commission in January, following the Grattan Institute in November calling for the government to include the family home in age pension eligibility and to cancel the increases in compulsory superannuation contributions.

The recommendations press-ganged former Prime Minister Paul Keating into vituperation mode with Leigh Sales on 7:30, cursing Grattan’s John Daley for “his miserable view” to “pilfering, stealing, robbing the workforce of 2.5 per cent of income.”

Whether Keating is just protective of the system he established in 1992, is providing cover for the $2.8 trillion industry (and labour leverage) he created, or both, is almost beside the point. Suffice it to say, PJK is a stakeholder in this vexed domain to be managed at all times with the highest degree of sensitivity.
description: Whatever you think of Frydenberg’s performance with the national abacus thus far, you cannot say he doesn’t respect his elders.
